posts.post_content:
He's got a big fat body for the right cost, he doesn't cost you any colored mana, and he is in a set that cares about artifacts. Seems like a fine **common** card to me. The game needs simple creatures, and this guy does what he needs to.  
  
I could see some situations where I would put this in a sealed deck. I wouldn't be that happy about it, but landing this thing would make a big difference on the board. I mean, people played [Alpha Tyrranax](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Alpha Tyrranax) is sealed and succeeded with him. Only problem is Mr. Hexplate here is vulnerable to artifact removal...
posts.html:
He's got a big fat body for the right cost, he doesn't cost you any colored mana, and he is in a set that cares about artifacts. Seems like a fine common card to me. The game needs simple creatures, and this guy does what he needs to.

I could see some situations where I would put this in a sealed deck. I wouldn't be that happy about it, but landing this thing would make a big difference on the board. I mean, people played Alpha Tyrranax is sealed and succeeded with him. Only problem is Mr. Hexplate here is vulnerable to artifact removal...
